A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
Well... at least this is better that EP VII\, although that's an easy task. 

On the plus side\, this is not a remake\, Mark Hamill is good\, it's very comforting to see Carrie Fisher\, excellent special effects and the final act including the light saber battle is original and well executed.

Unfortunately\, it feels more like an Ep IX instead of a middle episode\, it's a very long movie which they could sure cut 20-minute or so removing the "Fynn-Rose Casino travel/plot" since it does not add anything to the story saving everyone time and money\, the story is below average\, it does a poor job with the flow of the characters\, it's so obvious they want to disconnect form original trilogy (and they shouldn't) but they simply can't and they reconnect with a comment\, character or spaceship in order to keep the story somehow interesting.

In the end\, the story has a bad narrative\, it creates more questions than answers\, strong characters are underused and for the loyal / informed star wars fan you leave the theater with a bittersweet taste.
